channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WA

item.title: Report E-2023070919
item.description:
Report E-2023070919

  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: ALASKA AIRLINES, INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: UN3072 Life-saving appliance not-self inflating shipped by air without proper documentation, marking/labeling

item.title: Report X-2023070926
item.description:
Report X-2023070926

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-11
  • City: EAST WENATCHEE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package came out of trailer with wet stain on outer pack. Trapped package and inspected for damage. Upon retail inspection found one spray bottle leaking from spray cap. I unscrewed cap and screwed back down, that stopped the leaking. DescribePack: Leaking liquid from spray cap, didn't tighten down any more. So I unscrewed the spray cap and screwed back down. Leaking stopped from cap at that point. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Trapped package in QA area right away in Hazmat tote.

item.title: Report X-2023070839
item.description:
Report X-2023070839

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-07
  • City: DUPONT
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Pkg came to qa wet and with one side torn. Inspection showed 2 bottles had loose caps and were leaking, soiling all contents DescribePack: loose caps DurationRel: 12 and MitigateEffect: pkg placed in plastic bag and then in plastic tote

item.title: Report X-2023070746
item.description:
Report X-2023070746

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-04
  • City: TACOMA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: As package was being unload the package handler noticed the side of the package was wet. DescribePack: Loose caps DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once the leak was discovered the package was placed into a hazmat tote, taken to the damaged hazmat cage, and set under the vent.

item.title: Report X-2023070703
item.description:
Report X-2023070703

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-03
  • City: BURLINGTON
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was dropped, and discovred to be leaking. Package was immediately put into a red hazmat bin with a lid and brought to QA. DescribePack: Box is slightly crushed on one corner. Inside, one of the Jerrican bottle's cap has been pushed in, which caused the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was put into a red hazmat bin with a lid to mitigate the effects of the release.

item.title: Report X-2023070679
item.description:
Report X-2023070679

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-01
  • City: BURLINGTON
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was being unloaded from trailer when it was noticed package was leaking yellow liquid, was placed in hazmat tote and brought to QA for inspection DescribePack: Can dented on top and bottom breaking seal and staining other cains DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in hazmat tote and isolated from other boxes to reduce spillage

item.title: Report E-2023070678
item.description:
Report E-2023070678

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-21
  • City: SPOKANE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one case of paint (un 1950) had been damaged by a sharp object and that one of the inner metal 12 ounce can had released 12ounces of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain ands cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023060852
item.description:
Report X-2023060852

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-09T18:14:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-13
  • City: OLYMPIA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During sort operations at the OLMA facility a Fiberboard box containing a UN1956 was discovered. The outer fiberboard box did not have any DG markings of paperwork. Inside was another fiberboard box which was properly marked and had a declaration attached and inside of that fiberboard box was the metal cylinder. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and are being held for the FAA.

item.title: Report X-2023061317
item.description:
Report X-2023061317

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-05T21:09:27+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-15
  • City: TUKWILA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED BY A SUPERVISOR WHO THEN NOTIFIED A RESPONDER. ALL PPE (GLOVES, GOGGLES, BOOTS, APRON, SILVER LINING) WAS PUT ON AND PACKAGE WAS PUT INTO A YELLOW TUB/DMP BAG. PACKAGE WAS THEN TRANSFERRED TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. ALL PPE/TUBS WERE THEN DECONTAMINATED AND PACKAGE WAS FURTHER PROCESSED INTO ETT.
